title: Ex-law officers plead guilty to charges of torturing two Black men in US
description: Six white officers have agreed to sentences of between five and 30 years, recommended by Mississippi prosecutors.

title: Bankman-Fried slapped with new charges of using stolen funds for politics
description: The new US indictment charges the former billionaire with seven counts of conspiracy and fraud over the collapse of FTX.

title: US ambassador makes third visit to jailed journalist Evan Gershkovich
description: Ambassador Lynne Tracy renewed her appeal for Russia to release the reporter and imprisoned US Marine Paul Whelan.

title: Worst fighting in months as clashes hit Libyan capital Tripoli
description: Clashes erupt amid sounds of gunfire in Libya's Tripoli, residents say, after armed faction leader reportedly detained.

title: Hawaii wildfires: What caused deadliest US blazes in more than 100 years?
description: At least 96 people are reported dead, but US officials predict toll will mount as search efforts continue.

title: Libya asks Lebanon to release Gaddafi son on hunger strike: Officials
description: The health of Hannibal Gaddafi has been deteriorating since he went on hunger strike on June 3.

title: Bankman-Fried heads to Brooklyn jail notorious for poor conditions
description: A US judge ruled on Friday that he must be jailed for tampering with witnesses while free on bail at his parents' home.

title: Judge sides with youth activists in historic US climate crisis case
description: In a first-of-its-kind trial, US youth accuse Montana of violating their rights through lax environmental policies.

title: Sudan’s military leader accuses rival of committing war crimes
description: Abdel Fattah al-Burhan makes the accusation as fighting rages in Sudan, particularly in Khartoum and Darfur.

title: Has Russia pulled the plug on the Wagner Group?
description: Russia and Wagner now appear to be at odds, with reports suggesting Putin's government is no longer funding the group.

title: Copy of Quran desecrated outside Stockholm’s Royal Palace
description: Burning the Quran is permitted under Sweden's freedom of speech laws.

title: Who is Fani Willis, the Georgia district attorney investigating Trump?
description: The Fulton County district attorney is expected to bring election interference charges against former US president.

title: Five dead as boat carrying refugees sinks off Tunisia
description: The deaths include at least one child and two women, according to a judicial source.

title: Dozens dead as floods, landslides hit India’s Himalayan region
description: Days of downpours wash away vehicles, demolish buildings and destroy bridges in Himachal Pradesh and Uttarakhand

title: China’s defence minister visits Russia and Belarus in show of support
description: Beijing says visit underscores drive by China and Russia to align foreign policies to undermine West-led world order.

title: Dozens of people missing after Myanmar mine landslide
description: Mine debris sweeps workers into a lake in the remote town of Hpakant, the centre of Myanmar's jade industry.

title: Spain put issues aside in quest for Women’s World Cup glory
description: La Roja are a win away from a first final, less than a year after 15 players staged a revolt against coach Jorge Vilda.

title: ‘I saw many bodies that day’: Protester recounts Rabaa massacre 10 years on
description: Now settled in the UK, Amr Hashad says he sees no future for Egypt as long as the authorities evade justice.

title: Timeline: The Glazers’ troubled ownership of Manchester United
description: Nine months on from the Glazers' announcement that they were exploring a sale of the club, the process has stalled.

title: Roma pushed to turn on Ukrainian refugees in Czech Republic
description: Murder of a Roma man alleged to have been committed by a Ukrainian person sparks angry protests in the Czech Republic.

title: Suspected air strike kills two dozen people in Ethiopia’s Amhara region
description: The conflict is Ethiopia's biggest security crisis since a two-year civil war in the Tigray region ended in November.

title: Trump hits out at Georgia district attorney as fourth indictment looms
description: Former US president could soon face charges in state of Georgia over his efforts to overturn 2020 election results.

title: Spain vs Sweden preview: Women’s World Cup 2023 semi-final
description: A clash of styles as free-scoring Spain play set-piece specialists Sweden for a place in the Women's World Cup final.

title: ‘Don’t let the other soldiers watch’: Rape as a weapon of war in Sudan
description: Al Jazeera speaks to survivors of sexual violence, once again being used as a weapon of war, this time in Sudan.

title: Salma Paralluelo: ‘Unique’ rising star gives Spain game-changing powers
description: Coach, teammates say 19-year-old winger destined for greatness after scoring stunning winner in World Cup quarter-final.

title: Latvian PM Krisjanis Karins announces resignation
description: Krisjanis Karins, who has served since 2019, failed to convince coalition partners of a cabinet reshuffle.

title: Iran blames ISIL for shrine attack, arrests foreign nationals
description: Iran had executed two men in early June for the previous attack on Shah Cheragh that claimed 13 lives.

title: Russian rouble falls to levels seen at start of Ukraine invasion
description: Currency hits 17-month low with Moscow blaming 'loose monetary policy'.

title: Madagascar president’s aide charged with bribery in UK
description: The aide was arrested alongside a French associate, with the duo suspected of seeking a bribe from the miner Gemfields.

title: At least three killed in blast at hotel in Afghanistan’s Khost
description: Authorities say the explosion, which ripped through a hotel, left seven other people wounded.

title: Neymar set to join Saudi Arabia’s Al Hilal after PSG agree deal
description: The 31-year-old Brazilian star, who joined Paris St Germain in 2017, has agreed a two-year deal, Saudi state media says.

title: Guatemala presidential election: Unraveling the final candidates’ platforms
description: Progressive candidate Bernardo Arevalo will face off against conservative Sandra Torres in an August 20 run-off vote.

title: Party of slain Ecuador candidate taps Christian Zurita to take his place
description: Christian Zurita will take the place of Fernando Villavicencio in the August 20 elections, his party announces.

title: In the dragon’s shadow: US peace-dealing and wheeling in the Middle East
description: US attempts to curb Chinese power by cooking up yet another normalisation deal with Israel could backfire spectacularly.

title: ‘Turning point’: What happened during Egypt’s Rabaa massacre 10 years ago?
description: No official or entity was pursued for the killings, and the human rights situation in Egypt has only deteriorated since.

title: Maui wildfire survivors decry lack of warnings as death toll rises
description: Some residents refuse to vacate towns burned down to the ground, citing fear that they will not be able to return.

title: The reset in the US strategy on engaging the Taliban may work
description: A recent meeting in Doha shows that a major barrier to US-Taliban cooperation may have been surmounted.

title: Russia puts Navalny ally Ksenia Fadeyeva on trial for ‘extremism’
description: The trial of ex-local deputy in Tomsk is the latest in a series of cases brought against vocal critics of the Kremlin.

title: Who is Monu Manesar, Indian vigilante accused of inciting Haryana violence?
description: Video released by Manesar two days before violence in Nuh is believed to be the trigger, but he is yet to be arrested.

title: Cambodia school shut after war-era explosives unearthed
description: Deminers discover more than 2,000 explosives inside the grounds of a high school in northeastern Kratie province.

title: Polish PM Morawiecki seeks referendum on irregular migration
description: Polish premier looks to hold referendum to ask citizens if they support accepting 'illegal immigrants'.

title: Who is Javier Milei, Argentina’s far-right populist politician?
description: An admirer of Trump, Milei rocks Argentina's political establishment after winning most votes in presidential primary.

title: Annual Perseid meteor shower lights up skies around the world
description: The Perseid meteor shower reached its peak this weekend, sending bright trails of light streaking across the night sky.

title: Rohingya parents in Indonesia want ‘children to know happiness’
description: At a temporary shelter in Aceh, a mother who travelled by boat to Indonesia dreams of a better life for her children.

title: Jordan shoots down crystal meth-laden drone from Syria
description: Jordan has previously downed drones from Syria carrying narcotics but has rarely identified seized drugs as meth.

title: The future of the Muslim Brotherhood
description: Ten years after the massacre in Cairo's Rabaa Square, the Islamist movement is still trying to find its footing.

title: Taiwan will not back down in face of threats, William Lai says on US trip
description: Taiwan's vice president also reiterates a willingness to talk to China as he makes a brief stopover in New York City.

title: Far right Javier Milei wins most votes in Argentina’s primary election
description: Javier Milei's win is a stinging rebuke of the political establishment in a nation battered by economic woes.

title: Niger military to prosecute Mohamed Bazoum for ‘high treason’
description: Charges against Mohamed Bazoum come hours after a Nigerian delegation said Niger's coup leaders were open to diplomacy.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 537
description: These are the main developments as the Russian invasion of Ukraine enters its 537th day.

title: N Korea’s Kim orders ‘drastic boost’ in production of missiles, shells
description: Kim Jong Un inspected factories producing tactical missiles, mobile launch platforms and armoured vehicles.
